Lyrics: 1. Praise Him ! (2) JESUS, our Blessed Redeemer; n:Sing, O earth! His wonderful love proclaim! n:Hail Him ! (2) highest archangels in glory; n:Strength and honour, give to His holy name, n:Like a Shepherd, Jesus will guard His children, n:In His arms He carries them all day long; n:O ye saints that dwell in the mountains of Zion, n:Praise Him !(2) ever in joyful sound. n: n:2. Praise Him !(2) JESUS our Blessed Redeemer; n:For our sins He suffered and bled and died; n:HE, our Rock, our Hope of eternal salvation, n:Hail Him !(2) Jesus the crucified, n:Loving Saviour, meekly enduring sorrow, n:Crowned with thorns that cruelly pierced His brow; n:Once for us rejected, despised, and forsaken, n:Prince of Glory, ever triumphant now. n: n:3. Praise Him! (2) JESUS, our Blessed Redeemer, n:Heavenly portals, loud with hosannas ring! n:Jesus, Saviour, reigneth for- ever and ever n:Crown Him! (2) Prophet and Priest and King! n:Death is vanquished! tell it with joy, ye faithful, n:Where is now thy victory boasting grave? n:Jesus lives! no longer thy portals are cheerless; n:Jesus lives, the Mighty and strong to save.

1. Holy !(3) Lord God Almighty! n:Early in the morning our songs shall rise to Thee; n:Holy !(3) merciful and mighty! n:God in three persons, Blessed Trinity! n: n:2. Holy !(3) all the saints adore Thee, n:Casting down their golden crowns around the glassy sea; n:Cherubim and Seraphim falling down before Thee, n:Who wert, and art, and evermore shall be. n: n:3. Holy !(3) though the darkness hide Thee, n:Though the eye of sinful man Thy glory may not see; n:Only Thou art Holy, there is none beside Thee, n:Perfect in power, in love and purity. n: n:4. Holy !(3) Lord God Almighty n:All Thy works shall praise Thy name in earth, and sky, and sea: n:Holy !(3) Merciful and Mighty n:God in three persons, Blessed Trinity!

1. To God be the glory! great things He hath done; n:So loved He the world that He gave us His Son ; n:Who yielded His life an atonement for sin, n:And opened the Life–gate that all may go in. n: n:i:Praise the Lord !(2) let the earth hear His voice! n:i:Praise the Lord !(2) let the people rejoice! n:i:Oh, come to the Father, through Jesus the Son; n:i:And give Him the glory–– great things He hath done! n: n:2. O perfect redemption, the purchase of Blood, n:To every believer the promise of God; n:The vilest offender who truly believes, n:That moment from Jesus a pardon receives. n: n:3. Great things He hath taught us, great things He hath done, n:And great our rejoicing through Jesus The Son; n:But purer, and higher, and greater will be n:Our wonder, our transport, when Jesus we see.

1. O Lord my God! when I in awesome wonder n:Consider all the works Thy hand hath made, n:I see the stars, I hear the mighty thunder, n:Thy power throughout the universe displayed. n: n:i:Then sings my soul my Saviour God to Thee n:i:How great Thou art! How great Thou art! – 2 n: n:2. When through the woods and forest glades I wander n:And hear the birds sing sweetly in the trees; n:When I look down from lofty mountain grandeur n:And hear the brook, and feel the gentle breeze. n: n:3. And when I think that God, His Son not sparing n:Sent Him to die––I scarce can take it in; n:That on the cross, my burden gladly bearing n:He bled and died, to take away my sin. n: n:4. When Christ shall come with shout of acclamation n:And take me home––what joy shall fill my heart n:Then shall I bow in humble adoration, n:And there proclaim, my God, how great Thou art!
Writer: Translated from Russian by S. K. Hine, 1948

Lyrics: 1. All hail the power of Jesus’ name n:Let angels prostrate fall; n:Bring forth the royal diadem, n:And crown Him Lord of all. n: n:2. Crown Him, ye martyrs of our God n:Who from His altar call; n:Extol the stem of Jesse’s rod, n:And crown Him Lord of all. n: n:3. Ye saints redeemed of Adam’s race, n:Ye ransomed from the fall; n:Hail Him who saves you by His grace, n:And crown Him Lord of all. n: n:4. Sinners! whose love can ne’er forget n:The wormwood and the gall; n:Go spread your trophies at His feet, n:And crown Him Lord of all. n: n:5. Let every kindred, every tribe n:On this terrestrial ball, n:To Him all majesty ascribe, n:And crown Him Lord of all. n: n:6. Oh, that with yonder sacred throng n:We at His feet may fall, n:Join in the everlasting song, n:And crown Him Lord of all.

1. I will sing of my Redeemer, n:And His wondrous love to me; n:On the cruel cross He suffered, n:From the curse to set me free. n: n:i:Sing, oh sing of my Redeemer! n:i:With His blood He purchased me! n:i:On the cross he sealed my pardon, n:i:Paid the debt, and made me free. n: n:2. I will tell the wondrous story, n:How my lost estate to save, n:In His boundless love and mercy, n:He the ransom freely gave. n: n:3. I will praise my dear Redeemer, n:His triumphant power I’ll tell n:How the victory He giveth n:Over sin, and death, and hell. n: n:4. I will sing of my Redeemer, n:And His heavenly love to me, n:He from death to life hath brought me, n:Son of God, with Him to be.

1. Fairest of all the earth beside, n:Chiefest of all unto Thy bride, n:Fullness Divine in Thee I see, n:Wonderful man of Calvary. n: n:i:That Man of Calvary n:i:Has won my heart from me n:i:And died to set me free; n:i:Blest man of Calvary. n: n:2. Granting the sinner life and peace, n:Granting the captives sweet release, n:Shedding His blood to make us free, n:Merciful man of Calvary. n: n:3. Giving the gifts obtained for men, n:Pouring out love beyond our ken, n:Giving us spotless purity, n:Bountiful man of Calvary. n: n:4. Comfort of all my earthly way, n:Jesus I’ll meet Thee some sweet day, n:Centre of glory, Thee I’ll see, n:Wonderful man of Calvary.

1. King of my life, I crown Thee now, n:Thine shall the glory be, n:Lest I forget Thy thorn–crowned brow, n:Lead me to Calvary. n: n:i:Lest I forget Gethsemane, n:i:Lest I forget Thine agony; n:i:Lest I forget Thy love for me, n:i:Lead me to Calvary. n: n:2. Show me the tomb where Thou wast laid, n:Tenderly mourned and wept, n:Angels in robes of light arrayed n:Guarded Thee whilst Thou slept. n: n:3. Let me like Mary, through the gloom, n:Come with a gift to Thee; n:Show to me now the empty tomb, n:Lead me to Calvary. n: n:4. May I be willing Lord to bear n:Daily my cross for Thee; n:Even the cup of grief to share, n:Thou hast borne all for me.

1. When I survey the wondrous cross n:On which the Prince of Glory died, n:My richest gain I count but loss, n:And pour contempt on all my pride. n: n:2. Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast, n:Save in the cross of Christ my God; n:All the vain things that charm me most, n:I sacrifice them to His blood. n: n:3. See from His head, His hands, His feet, n:Sorrow and love flow mingled down; n:Did e’er such love and sorrow meet, n:Or thorns compose so rich a crown? n: n:4. Were the whole realm of nature mine, n:That were an offering far too small; n:Love so amazing, so Divine, n:Demands my soul, my life, my all.

1. The love that Jesus had for me, n:To suffer on the cruel tree, n:That I a ransom soul might be, n:Is more than tongue can tell! n: n:i:His love is more than tongue can tell! (2) n:i:The love that Jesus had for me n:i:Is more than tongue can tell! n: n:2. The bitter sorrow that He bore, n:And oh, the crown of thorns He wore, n:That I might live for evermore, n:Is more than tongue can tell! n: n:3. The peace I have in Him, my Lord n:Who pleads before the throne of God, n:The merit of His precious blood, n:Is more than tongue can tell! n: n:4. The joy that comes when He is near, n:The rest He gives, so free from fear, n:The hope in Him, so bright and clear, n:Is more than tongue can tell!

1.  Now, in a song of grateful praise, n:To my dear Lord my voice I’ll raise; n:With all His saints I’ll join to tell, n:My Jesus has done all things well. n: n:i:And above the rest this note shall swell, n:i:This note shall swell, this note shall swell; n:i:And above the rest this note shall swell; n:i:My Jesus has done all things well! n: n:2. How sovereign, wonderful, and free, n:Has been His love to sinful me! n:He plucked me from the jaws of hell; n:My Jesus has done all things well. n: n:3. Though many a fiery flaming dart n:The tempter levels at my heart–– n:With this I all His rage repel: n:My Jesus has done all things well. n: n:4. And when to that bright world I rise, n:And claim my mansion in the skies, n:Above the rest this note shall swell: n:My Jesus has done all things well.

1. On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross n:The emblem of suffering and shame n:And I love that old cross n:Where the dearest and blest n:For a world of lost sinners was slain n: n:i:So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross n:i:Till my trophies at last I lay down n:i:I will cling to the old rugged cross n:i:And exchange it someday for a crown. n: n:2. Oh! The old rugged cross n:So despised by the world n:Has a wondrous attraction for me n:For the dear Lamb of God n:Left His glory above n:To bear it to dark calvary. n: n:3. To the old rugged cross I will ever be true n:Its shame and reproach gladly bear n:Then he’ll call me some day n:To my home far away n:Where His glory for ever I’ll share.

1. Rejoice and be glad ! the Redeemer has come n:Go look on His cradle, His cross, and His tomb. n: n:i:Sound His praises ! tell the story of Him who was slain ! n:i:Sound His praises ! tell with gladness, He liveth again ! n: n:2. Rejoice and be glad ! it is sunshine at last n:The clouds have departed, the shadows are past. n: n:3. Rejoice and be glad ! for the blood hath been shed; n:Redemption is finished, the price hath been paid. n: n:4. Rejoice and be glad ! now the pardon is free! n:The Just for the unjust has died on the tree. n: n:5. Rejoice and be glad ! for the Lamb that was slain n:O'er death is triumphant, and liveth again. n: n:6. Rejoice and be glad ! for our King is on high ; n:He pleadeth for us on His throne in the sky. n: n:7. Rejoice and be glad ! for He cometh again; n:He cometh in glory, the Lamb that was slain. n:Sound His praises ! tell the story of Him who was slain! n:Sound His praises ! tell with gladness, He cometh again!

1. Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, n:All ye that are upright in heart; n:And ye that have made Him your choice, n:Bid sadness and sorrow depart. n: n:i:Rejoice !(2) n:i:Be glad in the Lord and rejoice! (2) n: n:2. Be joyful, for He is the Lord, n:On earth and in heaven supreme, n:He fashions and rules by His word n:The “mighty” and “strong” to redeem. n: n:3. What though in the conflict for right n:Your enemies almost prevail! n:God’s armies, just hid from your sight, n:Are more than the foes which assail. n: n:4. Though darkness surround you by day, n:Your sky by the night be o’ercast, n:Let nothing your spirit dismay, n:But trust till the danger is past. n: n:5. Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, n:His praises proclaiming in song: n:With harp and with organ, and voice, n:The loud hallelujahs prolong!

1. I feel like singing all the time, n:My tears are wiped away; n:For Jesus is a friend of mine, n:I’ll serve Him every day.  n:i:I’ll praise Him! praise Him! n:i:Praise Him all the time! n:i:Praise Him! Praise Him! n:i:I’ll praise Him all the time! n: n:2. When on the cross my Lord I saw, n:Nailed there by sins of mine, n:Fast fell the burning tears; n:But now I’m singing all the time. n: n:3. When fierce temptations try my heart, n:I’ll sing, “Jesus is mine!” n:And so though tears at times may start n:I’m singing all the time. n: n:4. The wondrous story of the Lamb n:Tell with that voice of thine, n:Till others, with the glad new song, n:Go singing all the time.

1. Oh worship the king , n:All – glorious above; n:O, gratefully sing n:His power and His love: n:Our shield and defender, n:The Ancient of Days, n:Pavilioned in splendour, n:And girded with praise. n: n:2. O, tell of His might, n:O, sing of His grace, n:Whose robe is the light, n:Whose canopy space; n:His chariots of wrath n:The deep thunder clouds form, n:And dark is His path n:On the wings of the storm. n: n:3. Frail children of dust, n:And feeble as frail, n:In Thee do we trust, n:Nor find Thee to fail; n:Thy mercies how tender, n:How firm to the end, n:Our maker, defender, n:Redeemer, and Friend. n: n:4. O measureless might, n:Ineffable love, n:While angels delight n:To hymn Thee above, n:Thy humbler creation, n:Though feeble their lays, n:With True Adoration n:Shall sing to Thy praise.

1. O, for a thousand tongues to sing n:My great Redeemer’s praise! n:The glories of my God and King, n:The triumphs of His grace. n: n:2. Jesus the name that charms our fears, n:That bids our sorrows cease; n:‘Tis music in the sinner’s ears, n:‘Tis life, and health, and peace. n: n:3. He speaks, and, listening to His voice, n:New life the dead receive, n:The mournful, broken hearts rejoice, n:The humble poor believe. n: n:4. Hear Him, ye deaf; His praise ye, dumb, n:Your loosened tongues employ; n:Ye blind behold your Saviour come; n:And leap, ye lame, for joy! n: n:5. See all your sins on Jesus laid: n:The Lamb of God was slain, n:His soul was once an offering made n:For every soul of man. n: n:6. He breaks the power of cancelled sin, n:He sets the prisoner free; n:His blood can make the foulest clean, n:His blood availed for me. n: n:7. My Gracious Master and my God, n:Assist me to proclaim, n:And spread through all the earth abroad n:The honours of Thy name.

1. Jesus our Lord, with what joy we adore Thee, n:Chanting our praise to Thyself on the throne! n:Blest in Thy presence we worship before Thee, n:Own Thou art worthy, and worthy alone. n: n:i:Lord, Thou art worthy (2) n:i:Lord, Thou art worthy, and worthy alone! n:i:Blest in Thy presence we worship before Thee, n:i:Own Thou art worthy, and worthy alone. n: n:2. Verily God, yet become truly human –– n:Lower than angels––to die in our stead; n:How hast Thou, long––promised “Seed of the woman”, n:Trod on the serpent and bruised his head! n: n:3. How didst thou humble Thyself to be taken, n:Led by Thy creatures and nailed to the cross! n:Hated of men, and of God, too forsaken, n:Shunning not darkness, the curse and the loss! n: n:4. How hast Thou triumphed, and triumphed with glory n:Battled death’s forces, rolled back every wave! n:Can we refrain, then, from telling the story? n:Lord, Thou art victor o’er death and the grave.

1. Behold, what love, what boundless love, n:The Father hath bestowed n:On sinners lost, that we should be n:Now called the sons of God. n: n:i:“Behold… what manner of love…. n:i:What manner of love the Father n:i:Hath bestowed upon us, that We…. n:i:...that we should be called.... n:i:Should be called the sons of God.” n: n:2. No longer far from Him, but now n:By precious blood made nigh; n:Accepted in the well – beloved, n:Near to God’s heart we lie. n: n:3. What we in glory soon shall be, n:It doth not yet appear; n:But when our precious Lord we see, n:We shall His image bear. n: n:4. With such a blessed hope in view, n:We should more holy be, n:More like our Risen, Glorious Lord, n:Whose face we soon shall see.

1. Lamb of God! our souls adore Thee n:While upon Thy face we gaze; n:There the Father’s love and glory n:Shine in all their brightest rays, n:Thine Almighty power and wisdom n:All creations works proclaim; n:Heaven and earth alike confess Thee n:As the ever great I Am. n: n:2. Lamb of God! Thy father’s bosom n:Ever was Thy dwelling place; n:His delight in Him rejoicing, n:One with Him in power and grace; n:O what wondrous love and mercy! n:Thou didst lay Thy glory by, n:And for us didst come from Heaven, n:As the Lamb of God, to die. n: n:3. Lamb of God! when we behold Thee n:Lowly in the manger laid; n:Wand’ring as a homeless stranger n:In the world Thy hands had made; n:When we see Thee in the garden, n:In Thine agony of blood; n:At Thy grace we are confounded, n:Holy, spotless Lamb of God. n: n:4. When we see Thee, as the victim, n:Bound to the accursed tree, n:For our guilt and folly stricken, n:All our judgements borne by Thee, n:Lord we own, with hearts adoring, n:Thou hast loved us unto blood, n:Glory, glory everlasting, n:Be to Thee, Thou Lamb of God.

1. Loved with everlasting love, n:Led by grace that love to know; n:Spirit breathing from above, n:Thou has taught me it is so, n:Oh, this full and prefect peace; n:Oh, this transport all Divine; n:In a love which cannot cease, n:I am His, and He is mine. n: n:2. Heaven above is softer blue, n:Earth around is sweeter green; n:Something lives in ev’ry hue n:Christless eyes have never seen: n:Birds with gladder songs o’erflow, n:Flowers with deeper beauty shine, n:Since I know, as now I know, n:I am His, and He is mine. n: n:3. Things that once were wild alarms n:Cannot now disturb my rest; n:Closed in everlasting arms, n:Pillowed on the Loving breast. n:Oh, to lie for ever here, n:Doubt and care and self resign, n:While He whispers in my ear, n:I am His, and He is mine. n: n:4. His for ever, only His; n:Who the Lord and me shall part? n:Ah, whith what a rest of bliss n:Christ can fill the loving heart. n:Heaven and earth may fade and flee, n:First – born light in gloom decline; n:But, while God and I shall be, n:I am His, and He is mine.

1. My Redeemer! O what beauties n:In that lovely name appear; n:None but Jesus in His glories, n:Shall the honoured title wear. n:My Redeemer! My Redeemer n:Thou hast my salvation wrought. n: n:2. Sunk in ruin, sin and misery, n:Bound by satan’s captive chain, n:Guided by His artful treachery, n:Hurrying on to endless pain; n:My Redeemer! My Redeemer n:Plucked me as a brand from hell. n: n:3. Mine by covenant, mine for ever, n:Mine by oath, and mine by blood, n:Mine––nor time the bond shall sever n:Mine as an unchanging God. n:My Redeemer! My Redeemer n:O how sweet to call Thee mine! n: n:4. When in heaven I see Thy glory, n:When before Thy throne I bow, n:Perfected I shall be like Thee, n:Fully Thy redemption know. n:My Redeemer! My Redeemer n:Then shall hear me shout His praise.

1. Through Thy precious body broken n:Inside the veil; n:O what words to sinners spoken n:Inside the veil! n:Precious as the blood that bought us, n:Perfect as the love that sought us, n:Holy as the Lamb that brought us n:Inside the veil. n: n:2. When we see Thy love unshaken n:Outside the camp; n:Scorned by man, by God forsaken, n:Outside the camp; n:Thy loved cross alone can charm us, n:Shame need now no more alarm us, n:Glad we follow, nought can harm us n:Outside the camp. n: n:3. Lamb of God, through Thee we enter n:Inside the veil; n:Cleansed by Thee, we boldly venture n:Inside the veil; n:Not a stain; a new creation; n:Ours is such a full salvation; n:Low we bow in adoration n:Inside the veil. n: n:4. Unto Thee, the homless stranger, n:Outside the camp, n:Forth we hasten, fear no danger n:Outside the camp, n:Thy reproach, far richer treasure n:Than all Egypt’s boasted pleasure; n:Drawn by love that knows no measure, n:Outside the camp. n: n:5. Soon Thy saints shall all be gathered n:Inside the veil; n:All at home, no more be scattered, n:Inside the veil. n:Nought from Thee our hearts shall sever: n:We shall see Thee, grieve Thee never; n:“Praise the Lamb!”  shall sound for ever n:Inside the veil

1. Who can cheer the heart like Jesus n:By His presence all Divine? n:True and tender, pure and precious, n:O how blest to call Him mine! n: n:i:All that thrills my soul is Jesus; n:i:He is more than life to me; n:i:And the fairest of ten thousand, n:i:In my blessed Lord I see. n: n:2. Love of Christ so freely given, n:Grace of God beyond degree, n:Mercy higher than the heaven, n:Deeper than the deepest sea. n: n:3. What a wonderful redemption! n:Never can a mortal know n:How my sin though red like crimson, n:Can be whiter than the snow. n: n:4. Every need His hand supplying, n:Every good in Him I see; n:On His strength Divine relying, n:He is all in all to me. n: n:5. By the crystal flowing river n:With the ransomed I will sing, n:And for ever and for ever, n:Praise and glorify the King.

1. Low in the grave He lay–– n:Jesus, my Saviour! n:Waiting the coming day–– n:Jesus, my Lord! n: n:i:Up from the grave He arose, n:i:With a mighty triumph o’er His foes; n:i:He arose a Victor from the dark domain n:i:And He lives for ever with His saints to reign: n:i:He arose! He arose! n:i:Hallelujah! Christ arose! n: n:2. Vainly they watch His bed–– n:Jesus, my Saviour n:Vainly they seal The Dead–– n:Jesus, my Lord. n: n:3. Death cannot keep His prey–– n:Jesus, my Saviour n:He tore the bars away–– n:Jesus, my Lord.

1. The great Physician now is near, n:The Sympathising Jesus; n:He speaks the drooping heart to cheer, n:Oh, hear the voice of Jesus! n: n:i:Sweetest note in seraph song, n:i:Sweetest name on mortal tongue, n:i:Sweetest carol ever sung: n:i:Jesus! blessed Jesus! n: n:2. Your many sins are all forgiven; n:Oh, hear the voice of Jesus! n:Go on your way in peace to heaven, n:And wear a crown with Jesus. n: n:3. All glory to the Risen Lamb! n:I now believe in Jesus; n:I love the blessed Saviour’s Name, n:I love the name of Jesus. n: n:4. Come, brethren, help me sing His praise, n:Oh, praise the name of Jesus! n:Come, sisters, all your voices raise, n:Oh, bless the Name of Jesus! n: n:5. And when to the bright world above n:We rise to see our Jesus, n:We’ll sing around the throne of love n:His Name, the Name of Jesus.

1. Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power? n:Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? n:Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour? n: n:i:Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? n:i:Are you washed in the blood, n:i:In the soul cleansing blood of the Lamb? n:i:Are your garments spotless, n:i:Are they white as snow? n:i:Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? n: n:2. Are you walking daily by the Saviour’s side? n:Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? n:Do you rest each moment in the Crucified? n:Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb? n: n:3. When the bridegroom cometh will your robes be white? n:Pure and white in the blood of the Lamb? n:Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright, n:And be washed in the blood of the Lamb? n: n:4. Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin. n:And be washed in the blood of the Lamb! n:There’s a fountain flowing for the soul unclean –– n:Oh, be washed in the blood of the Lamb.

1. Would you be free from your burden of sin? n:There’s power in the blood, power in the blood n:Would you o’er evil a victory win? n:There’s wonderful power in the blood. n: n:i:There is power, power, n:i:Working power n:i:In the blood of the Lamb; n:i:There is power, power, n:i:Wonder working power, n:i:In the precious blood of the Lamb. n: n:2. Would you be free from your passion and pride? n:There’s power in the blood, power in the blood; n:Come for a cleansing to Calvary’s tide, n:There’s wonderful power in the blood. n: n:3. Would you be whiter, much whiter than snow? n:There’s power in the blood, power in the blood, n:Sin–stains are lost in its life–giving flow, n:There’s wonderful power in the blood. n: n:4. Would you do service for Jesus your King? n:There’s power in the blood, power in the blood; n:Would you live daily His praises to sing? n:There’s wonderful power in the blood.

1. My hope is built on nothing less n:Than Jesus’ blood and righteousness; n:I dare not trust the sweetest frame, n:But wholly lean on Jesus’ name. n: n:i:On Christ, the Solid Rock, I stand; n:i:All other ground is sinking sand, n:i:All other ground is sinking sand. n: n:2. When darkness seems to veil His face, n:I rest on His unchanging grace; n:In ev’ry high and stormy gale n:My anchor holds within the vail. n: n:3. His oath, His covenant, His blood, n:Support me in the ‘whelming flood; n:When all around my soul gives way, n:He then is all my hope and stay. n: n:4. And when I hear the trumpet sound, n:Oh, may I then in Him be found, n:Clothed in His righteousness alone, n:Faultless to stand before His throne.

1. In tenderness He sought me, n:Weary and sick with sin, n:And on His shoulders brought me n:Back to His fold again; n:While angels in His presence sang, n:Until the courts of heaven rang. n: n:i:Oh, the love that sought me! n:i:Oh, the blood that bought me! n:i:Oh, the grace that brought me to the fold, n:i:Wondrous grace that brought me to the fold! n: n:2. He wash’d the bleeding sin–wounds, n:And pour’d in oil and wine; n:He whisper’d to assure me, n:I’ve found Thee, thou art Mine n:I never heard a sweeter voice, n:It made my aching heart rejoice. n: n:3. He pointed to the nail–prints, n:For me His blood was shed, n:A mocking crown so thorny n:Was placed upon His head: n:I wonder’d what He saw in me n:To suffer such deep agony. n: n:4. I’m sitting in His presence, n:The sunshine of His face, n:While with adoring wonder n:His blessings I retrace, n:It seems as if eternal days n:Are far too short to sound His praise. n: n:5. So while the hours are passing, n:All now is perfect rest; n:I’m waiting for the morning, n:The brightest and the best, n:When He will call us to His side, n:To be with Him His spotless bride.

1. Ho, my comrades! see the signal n:Waving in the sky! n:Reinforcements now appearing n:Victory is nigh! n: n:i:“Hold the fort, for I am coming” n:i:Jesus signals still; n:i:Wave the answer back to heaven, n:i:“By Thy grace we will!” n: n:2. 1. Down in the valley with my Saviour I would go, n:Where the flowers are blooming and the sweet waters flow, n:Everywhere He leads me I would follow, follow on, n:Walking in His footsteps till the crown be won.  n:i:Follow! Down in the valley with my Saviour I would go, n:Where the stroms are sweeping and the dark waters flow, n:With His hands  to lead me I will never, never fear: n:Dangers cannot fright me if my Lord is near. n: n:3. Jesus, lover of my soul let me to Thy bosom fly, n:While the nearer waters roll, n:While the tempest still is high; n:Hide me, O my saviour, hide, n:Still the storm of life be past; n:Safe into the haven guide, n:Oh, receive my soul at last. n: n:2. No, not one! n: n:i:Jesus knows all about our struggles, n:i:He will guide till the day is done; n:i:And there’s not a friend like the lowly Jesus, n:i:No, not one! No, not one! n: n:2. 1. 1. All to Jesus I surrender, all to Him I freely give; n:I will ever love and trust Him, in His presence daily live. n: n:i:I surrender all, I surrender all; n:i:All to Thee, my blessed Saviour, n:i:I surrender all. n: n:2. All to Jesus I surrender, humbly at His feet I bow; n:Worldly pleasures all forsaken–take me, Jesus, take me now. n: n:3. All to Jesus I surrender, make me Saviour, wholly Thine; n:Let the Holy Spirit witness I am Thine and Thou art mine. n: n:4. All to Jesus I surrender: Lord, I give myself to Thee; n:Fill me with Thy love and power, let Thy blessing rest on me. n: n:5. 1. I am Thine O Lord, I have heard Thy voice, n:And it told Thy love to me; n:But I longed to rise, in the arms of faith, n:And be closer drawn to Thee. n: n:i:Draw me nea….rer, nearer, Blessed Lord, n:i:To the cross where Thou hast died: n:i:Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, Blessed Lord, n:i:To Thy precious, wounded side. n: n:2. Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord, n:By the power of grace divine; n:Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope, n:And my will be lost in Thine. n: n:3. Oh, the pure delight of a single hour n:That before Thy throne I spend, n:When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee, my God, n:I commune as friend with friend. n: n:4. There are depths of love that I cannot know n:Till I cross the narrow sea; n:There are heights of joy that I may not reach n:Till I rest in peace with Thee.

1. Naught have I gotten but what I received; n:Grace hath bestow’d it since I have believed; n:Boasting excluded, pride I abase; n:I’m only a sinner, saved by grace. n: n:i:Only a sinner saved by grace! n:i:Only a sinner saved by grace! n:i:This is my story - to God be the glory- n:i:I’m only a sinner saved by grace! n: n:2. 1. O happy day that fixed my choice n:On Thee, my Saviour and my God! n:Well may this glowing heart rejoice, n:And tell its raptures all abroad. n: n:i:Happy day, happy day, n:i:When Jesus wash’d my sins away! n:i:He teaches me to watch and pray; n:i:And live rejoicing every day. n:i:Happy day, happy day, n:i:When Jesus wash’d my sins away! n: n:2. O happy bond, that seals my vows n:To Him who merits all my love; n:Let cheerful anthems fill His house, n:While to that sacred shrine I move. n: n:3. ‘Tis done, the great transaction’s done, n:I am my Lord’s, and He is mine; n:He drew me, and I followed on, n:Charmed to confess the voice divine. n: n:4. O Christ, in Thee my soul hath found, n:And found in Thee alone, n:The peace, the joy I sought so long, n:The bliss till now unknown. n: n:i:Now none but Christ can satisfy, n:i:None other name for me; n:i:There’s love and life and lasting joy, n:i:Lord Jesus, found in Thee. n: n:2. I sighed for rest and happiness n:I yearned for them, not Thee, n:But while I passed my Saviour by, n:His love laid hold on me. n: n:3. I tried the broken cisterns, Lord, n:But, ah, the waters failed! n:E’en as I stooped to drink they fled, n:And mocked me as I wailed. n: n:4. 1. When peace like a river attendeth my way, n:When sorrows like sea billows roll; n:Whatever my lot Thou hast taught me to say, n:“It is well, it is well with my soul!” n: n:i:It is well with my soul! n:i:It is well with my soul! n:i:It is well, it is well with my soul! n: n:2. Though Satan should buffet, tho’ trial should come; n:Let this blest assurance control, n:That Christ hath regarded my helpless estate, n:And hath shed His own blood for my soul. n: n:3. My sin – oh, the bliss of this glorious thought– n:My sin, not in part, but the whole, n:Is nailed to His Cross, and I bear it no more; n:Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, O my soul! n: n:4. For me, be it Christ, be it Christ, hence to live; n:If Jordan above me shall roll, n:No pang shall be mine, for in death as in life n:Thou wilt whisper Thy peace to my soul. n: n:5. But, Lord, ’tis for Thee, for Thy coming, we wait; n:The sky, not the grave, is our goal: n:Oh, trump of the Angel! oh, voice of the Lord! n:Blessed hope! blessed rest of my soul!

1. Will your anchor hold in the storms of life? n:When the clouds unfold their wings of strife; n:When the strong tides lift and the cables strain, n:Will your anchor drift, or firm remain? n: n:i:We have an anchor that keeps the soul n:i:Steadfast and sure while the billows roll; n:i:Fastened to the rock which cannot move, n:i:Grounded firm and deep in the Saviour’s love! n: n:2. Will your anchor hold in the straits of fear? n:When the breakers roar and the reef is near; n:While the surges rave, and the wild winds blow, n:Shall the angry wave then your bark o’erflow? n: n:3. Will our anchor hold in the folds of death, n:When the waters cold chill your latest breath? n:On the rising tide you can never fail, n:While your anchor holds within the veil. n: n:4. Will your eyes behold through the morning light n:The city of gold, and the harbour bright? n:Will you anchor safe by the heavenly shore, n:When life’s storms are past for evermore?

1. What a wonderful change in my life has been wrought n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n:I have light in my soul for which long I had sought, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n: n:i:Since Jesus came into my heart, n:i:Since Jesus came into my heart, n:i:Floods of joy o’er my soul like the sea billows roll, n:i:Since Jesus came into my heart. n: n:2. I have ceased from my wand’ring and going astray, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n:And my sins which were many are all washed away n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n: n:3. I’m possessed of a hope that is steadfast and sure, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n:And no dark clouds of doubt now my pathway obscure, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n: n:4. There’s a light in the valley of death now for me, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n:And the gates of the City beyond I can see, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n: n:5. I shall go there to dwell in that City I know, n:Since Jesus came into my heart! n:And I’m happy, so happy as onward I go, n:Since Jesus came into my heart!

1. Come, Thou Fount of every blessing, n:Tune my heart to sing Thy grace; n:Streams of mercy never ceasing n:Call for songs of loudest praise. n:Teach me some melodious measure n:Sung by flaming tongues above; n:O the vast, the boundless treasure n:Of my Lord’s unchanging love! n: n:2. Here I raise my Ebenezer; n:Hither by Thy help I’m come; n:And I hope, by Thy good pleasure, n:Safely to arrive at home. n:Jesus sought me when a stranger, n:Wandering from the fold of God. n:He, to rescue me from danger, n:Interposed His precious blood. n: n:3. O to grace how great a debtor n:Daily I’m constrained to be! n:Let that grace, Lord, like a fetter, n:Bind my wandering heart to Thee; n:Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it, n:Prone to leave the God I love; n:Take my heart, O take and seal it, n:Seal it for Thy courts above.

1. I will sing the wondrous story n:Of the Christ who died for me; n:How He left His home in glory, n:For the cross on Calvary. n: n:i:Yes I’ll sing the wondrous story n:i:Of the Christ who died for me; n:i:Sing it with the saints in glory, n:i:Gathered by the crystal sea. n: n:2. I was lost; but Jesus found me– n:Found the sheep that went astray; n:Threw His loving arms around me, n:Drew me back into His way. n: n:3. I was bruised: but Jesus healed me– n:Faint was I from many a fall; n:Sight was gone, and fears possessed me: n:But He freed me from them all. n: n:4. Days of darkness still come o’er me; n:Sorrow’s paths I often tread; n:But the Saviour still is with me, n:By His hand I’m safely led. n: n:5. He will keep me till the river n:Rolls its waters at my feet; n:Then He’ll bear me safely over, n:Where the loved ones I shall meet.

What can wash away my stain? n:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n:What can make me whole again? n:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n: n:i:Oh, precious is the flow, n:i:That makes me white as snow! n:i:No other fount I know, n:i:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n: n:2. For my cleansing this I see – n:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n:For my pardon this my plea– n:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n: n:3. Nothing can for sin atone – n:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n:Naught of good that I have done – n:Nothing but the blood of Jesus! n: n:4. 1. Jesus loves me! this I know, n:For the Bible tells me so; n:Little ones to Him belong, n:They are weak, but He is strong. n: n:i:Yes, Jesus loves me! n:i:Yes, Jesus loves me! n:i:Yes, Jesus loves me! n:i:The Bible tells me so. n: n:2. Jesus loves me! He who died, n:Heaven’s gate to open wide; n:He will wash away my sin, n:Let His little child come in. n: n:3. Jesus loves me! He will stay n:Close beside me, all the way; n:If I love Him, when I die n:He will take me home on high.

Pass me not, O gentle Saviour, n:Hear my humble cry; n:While on others Thou art calling, n:Do not pass me by. n: n:i:Saviour, Saviour! n:i:Hear my humble cry. n:i:And while others Thou art calling, n:i:Do not pass me by. n: n:2. Let me at the throne of mercy n:Find a sweet relief; n:As I kneel in deep contrition, n:Help my unbelief. n: n:3. Trusting only in Thy merit, n:Would I seek Thy face; n:Heal my wounded, broken spirit, n:Save me by Thy grace. n: n:4. Thou the spring of all my comfort, n:More than life to me; n:Whom have I on earth beside Thee? n:Whom in heaven but Thee?

I hear Thy welcome voice, n:That calls me, Lord, to Thee, n:For cleansing in Thy precious blood n:That flowed on Calvary. n: n:i:I am coming, Lord, n:i:Coming now to Thee; n:i:Wash me, cleanse me in the blood n:i:That flowed from Calvary. n: n:2. Though coming weak and vile, n:Thou dost my strength assure; n:Thou dost my vileness fully cleanse, n:Till spotless all, and pure. n: n:3. ’Tis Jesus calls me on n:To perfect faith and love, n:To perfect hope, and peace, and trust, n:For earth and heaven above. n: n:4. ’Tis Jesus who confirms n:The blessed work within, n:By adding grace to welcomed grace, n:Where reigned the power of sin. n: n:5. All hail, atoning blood! n:All hail, redeeming grace! n:All hail, the gift of Christ our Lord, n:Our strength and righteousness.

1. Rock of Ages, cleft for me, n:Let me hide myself in Thee; n:Let the water and the blood, n:From Thy wounded side which flowed, n:Be of sin the double cure, n:Cleanse me from its guilt and power. n: n:2. Not the labor of my hands n:Can fulfil Thy laws demand; n:Could my zeal no respite know, n:Could my tears for ever flow, n:All for sin could not atone; n:Thou must save, and Thou alone. n: n:3. While I draw this fleeting breath, n:When mine eyes shall close in death, n:When I soar to worlds unknown, n:See Thee on the judgement throne; n:Rock of Ages, cleft for me, n:Let me Hide myself in Thee.

Marvellous grace of our loving Lord, n:Grace that exceeds our sin and our guilt, n:Yonder on Calvary’s mount outpoured , n:There where the blood of the Lamb was spilt. n: n:i:Grace, grace, God’s grace, n:i:Grace that will pardon and cleanse within; n:i:Grace, grace, God’s grace, n:i:Grace that is greater than all our sin. n: n:2. Sin and despair like the sea waves cold, n:Threaten the soul with infinite loss; n:Grace that is greater, yes, grace untold, n:Points to the Refuge, the mighty Cross. n: n:3. Dark is the stain that we cannot hide, n:What can avail to wash it away? n:Look! there is flowing a crimson tide, n:Whiter than snow you may be today. n: n:4. Marvellous, infinite, matchless grace, n:Freely bestowed on all who believe; n:You that are longing to see His face, n:Will you this moment His grace receive?

Jesus saves! n:Bear the news to ev’ry land; n:Climb the steeps and cross the waves; n:Onward! ’tis our Lord’s command: n:Jesus saves! Jesus saves! n: n:2. Waft it on the rolling tide, n:Jesus saves! Jesus saves! n:Tell to sinners, far and wide, n:Jesus saves! Jesus saves! n:Sing, ye islands of the sea! n:Echo back, ye ocean caves! n:Earth shall keep the jubilee: n:Jesus saves! 1. When we walk with the Lord, n:In the light of His word, n:What a glory He sheds on our way; n:While we do His good will n:He abides with us still, n:And with all who will trust and obey. n: n:i:Trust and obey, n:i:For there’s no other way n:i:To be happy in Jesus, n:i:But to trust and obey. n: n:2.
